source: ReliefWeb Central African Republic Cholera Outbreak Oct 2011
processing_notes: Source states: 'government declared epidemic on 30 Sept 2011 with 51 cases and 11 deaths registered. Total reached 172 cases and 16 deaths by mid-October' - interpreted as sCh cases

source: Seventh Pandemic Vibrio cholerae O1 Sublineages Central African Republic PMC
processing_notes: Source states: 'In the first, 443 cases and 88 deaths were reported in southern CAR, along the Oubangui River, close to the border with DRC' - interpreted as sCh cases

source: Emergence of cholera in Central African Republic PubMed Germani 1998
processing_notes: Source states: 'In the second, 113 cases and 19 deaths were reported in northern CAR, close to borders with Cameroon and Chad' - interpreted as sCh cases

source: UNICEF Central African Republic Cholera Absence Validation 1998-2010
processing_notes: Source confirms zero cholera transmission during 1998-2010 period - validated absence via UNICEF official statement: 'Because CAR has not had cholera cases in many years, people do not necessarily know what basic measures to take' (2011)

source: WHO African Region Cholera Surveillance CAR Absence 2017-2025
processing_notes: Source confirms zero cholera transmission during 2017-2025 period - validated absence via WHO surveillance system: CAR absent from all WHO African Region cholera bulletins and outbreak reports 2018-2024, not listed among 14 active cholera countries
